S |-> B ` is a decreasing function with antiderivative ` A ` converging to zero, then the difference between ` sum_ k e. ( M ... ( |_ `` x ) ) B ( k ) ` and ` A ( x ) = S. u e. ( M [,] x ) B ( u ) _d u ` converges to a constant limit value, with the remainder term bounded by ` B ( x ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-May-2016.)
